meanings.definition: To equip or arm with military forces
meanings.sent1: The country was militarising its borders to protect its citizens.
meanings.sent2: The government was militarising the troops for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent3: The idea of militarising the school lunchroom with food fights is absurd.
meanings.sent4: His words were like militarising my heart, preparing it for battle.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds were militarising the sky, ready to unleash their fury.

meanings.definition: To make military in character or appearance
meanings.sent1: The new uniforms were militarising the look of the team.
meanings.sent2: The propaganda posters were militarising the public's perception of the war.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt at militarising its meow to sound tough was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules were militarising the atmosphere of the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The old castle was militarising the landscape, standing tall and imposing.
